author: Odeinoichus
title: Sinister Fear Monger!
review:
Set #71026 Sinestro: We've gotten this character once before, in a Green Lantern set, but this variant gives us a few things we didn't have before. Notably the Yellow Lantern Ring printed tile and Yellow Lantern accessory piece.

Before Sinestro wore yellow every day he had this original costume. Dressed in black with blue highlights, Sinestro travelled the cosmos seeking a means of combating the Green Lantern Corps after he was discharged. He found the Yellow Lantern and used it, along with a Yellow power ring, to spread fear and misery across the cosmos. Everything about Sinestro is new, his print, his facial expressions, his accessories, but this is a variant of the character and not a new character. Hopefully if they make a Series 2 we'll start to see other Lantern Corps members.

Highly Recommended. This figure looks great, the accessories are perfect and he's a must have for fans of the character.

author: BelgianBricker
title: Exactly what you would expect
review:
Vintage Sinestro - nice.

If any version of Sinestro should have been made for the collectible minifigure series this should have been the one: old-school and classic.

Everything is right with this one: the costume matches the comic-book character perfectly, with some simple but effective arm and legprinting; a silver belt runs around his waste and hard to notice dark blue (?) lines define muscles on his front and back.

A marvellous yellow lantern en ring-piece create the finishing touch. Splendid. I would love to see more lantern factions being released, but it is most likely we will not see them represented...

Just one thought: this character is sleek, slim and slender. LEGO has made tall legs (Toy Story).
For some characters, it would mean a world of difference. Just imagine how much better Sinestro would have looked...a missed opportunity.
